bug.author: jiacheliu3
bug.summary: Alluxio on Docker failed to format journal
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: 2.2.0-SNAPSHOT Describe the bug There's no ssh command in Alluxio docker image. When doing formatJournal in HA mode the command will fail. <denchmark-code>$ kubectl exec -it alluxio-master-0 bash bash-4.4$ ssh bash: ssh: command not found bash-4.4$ bin/alluxio formatMasters Executing the following command on all master nodes and logging to /opt/alluxio-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/logs/task.log: /opt/alluxio-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/bin/alluxio formatJournal Waiting for tasks to finish... Task on 'localhost' fails, exit code: 127 There are task failures, look at /opt/alluxio-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/logs/task.log for details. bash-4.4$ cat logs/task.log Executing the following command on all master nodes and logging to /opt/alluxio-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/logs/task.log: /opt/alluxio-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/bin/alluxio formatJournal [localhost] Connecting as ... [2020-02-19 15:03:16][localhost] nohup: can't execute 'ssh': No such file or directory </denchmark-code>
To Reproduce As above Expected behavior formatJournal should work from masters/workers and client side too(if client side is configured). Urgency Medium Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ZacBlanco>@ZacBlanco</denchmark-link> How much overhead is adding to our docker image?

The general idea is you should not really be executing commands within the container. Format is an odd one - but generally no, we shouldn't have ssh installed because it would imply all of the other containers have an ssh server running which is another daemon that would need to run in the background. For k8s or docker its expected for users to run the commands manually at this point; i.e. formatMaster and formatWorker
